It's amazing to read the hypocrisy surrounding this. We have thousands of EU workers contributing a lot of time and money in the UK, but we will be making them feel like second class citizens. We all loved the fact that it is much easier for us to travel through Europe without all the border checks, but when strengthening of the borders is needed we pull the plug on the rest. I'm not saying that I love the fact that the EU Parliament exists, as it is far too powerful and there have been serious errors when new countries apply to join the EU. We have many thousands of UK citizens living in other EU countries - just how is pulling out going to affect them, or are they just going to be looked upon as traitors to their country? The U.K. is tiny and fairly unimportant in the modern world, it needs allies close at hand - I say this even though I absolutely love my country.

I see that a lot of the comments here are about privatized health care... We have it here in the States, and it is HORRIBLE.... the PRIVATE insurers will take you for every penny that you have, and will, can, deny you... Until President Obama made them,, now, with Trump,, the rates will go even higher.. I was paying over 800.00 PER MONTH.. and they would not pay anything until I had paid out the first $8.000.00. Then they would only pay a percentage, then I had to pay an extra $10,000.00 before they would pay the full bill....

Sam Dean, the ACA was a REPUBLICAN idea in the beginning. If the Republicans would have worked WITH President Obama, it could have been a complete success. But, they would not. Even when the ACA would have been completely covered by the Government 100% for the first 3 years, then, the States would only have to pay 10 % after that,, saving the states millions of dollars. But, the Republican Governors fought him, and would NOT offer the ACA to their people. Which threw a wrench into the  works.. The Republicans knew that by doing this, that it would cause trouble. The Republican governors also nick named the ACA as "Obama" care, which turned people against it. So, when some of the Republican Governors decided to go with the program, they called it a different name, such as, Michcare ( for Michigan).  You ask a person from a Republican state about their health coverage.. and they will say,, I love it,, but I am glad that I don't have Obama care... it is the VERY SAME THING !
